definition:
Let $X$ be a topological space, and let $Y \subset X$ be a subset. The
[*subspace topology*]{} on $Y$ is the topology whose open sets are those
subsets of $Y$ which equal $U \cap Y$ for some open set $U \subset X$.

In this context, the topological space $Y$ obtained by taking the
subspace topology is called a [*topological subspace*]{}, or simply
[*subspace*]{}, of $X$.
